t: Deuteronomy 1
These*p be the words which Moses spake unto all Israel on this side Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against the Red sea, between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
(There*p are eleven days' journey from Horeb by the way of mount Seir unto Kadesh–barnea.)

And*p it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spake unto the children of Israel, according unto all that the Lord*s had given him in commandment unto them;
After*p he had slain Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, which dwelt at Ashtaroth in Edrei:
On*p this side Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,
The*p Lord*s our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mount:

Turn*p you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the Amorites, and unto all the places nigh thereunto, in the plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the sea side, to the land of the Canaanites, and unto Lebanon, unto the great river, the river Euphrates.
Behold,*p I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which the Lord*s sware unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.
And*p I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:
The*p Lord*s your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.
(The*p Lord*s God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you!)
How*p can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
Take*p you wise men, and understanding, and known among your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.
And*p ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good for us to do.

So*p I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and officers among your tribes.
And*p I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear the causes between your brethren, and judge righteously between every man and his brother, and the stranger that is with him.

Ye*p shall not respect persons in judgment; but ye shall hear the small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man; for the judgment is God's: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring it unto me, and I will hear it.
And*p I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.

And*p when we departed from Horeb, we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the Lord*s our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh–barnea.
And*p I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the Amorites, which the Lord*s our God doth give unto us.
Behold,*p the Lord*s thy God hath set the land before thee: go up and possess it, as the Lord*s God of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.

And*p ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, We will send men before us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring us word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we shall come.
And*p the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:
And*p they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the valley of Eshcol, and searched it out.
And*p they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, It is a good land which the Lord*s our God doth give us.
Notwithstanding*p ye would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord*s your God:
And*p ye murmured in your tents, and said, Because the Lord*s hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.

Whither*p shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.
Then*p I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.
The*p Lord*s your God which goeth before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes;
And*p in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that the Lord*s thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way that ye went, until ye came into this place.
Yet*p in this thing ye did not believe the Lord*s your God,
Who*p went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, to shew you by what way ye should go, and in a cloud by day.
And*p the Lord*s heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,
Surely*p there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see that good land, which I sware to give unto your fathers,
Save*p Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath wholly followed the Lord.*s
Also*p the Lord*s was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not go in thither.
But*p Joshua the son of Nun, which standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: encourage him: for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.

Moreover*p your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, and your children, which in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
But*p as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.

Then*p ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the Lord,*s we will go up and fight, according to all that the Lord*s our God commanded us. And when ye had girded on every man his weapons of war, ye were ready to go up into the hill.
And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight; for I am not among you; lest ye be smitten before your enemies.
So*p I spake unto you; and ye would not hear, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord,*s and went presumptuously up into the hill.
And*p the Amorites, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir, even unto Hormah.
And*p ye returned and wept before the Lord;*s but the Lord*s would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.
So*p ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye abode there.
Deuteronomy 2
Then*p we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea, as the Lord*s spake unto me: and we compassed mount Seir many days.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto me, saying,
Ye*p have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.

And*p command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau, which dwell in Seir; and they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore:
Meddle*p not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; because I have given mount Seir unto Esau for a possession.
Ye*p shall buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.

For*p the Lord*s thy God hath blessed thee in all the works of thy hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great wilderness: these forty years the Lord*s thy God hath been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing.

And*p when we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath, and from Ezion–geber, we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.

And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Distress not the Moabites, neither contend with them in battle: for I will not give thee of their land for a possession; because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot for a possession.
The*p Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims;
Which*p also were accounted giants, as the Anakims; but the Moabites call them Emims.

The*p Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which the Lord*s gave unto them.
Now*p rise up, said I, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.

And*p the space in which we came from Kadesh–barnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, was thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host, as the Lord*s sware unto them.
For*p indeed the hand of the Lord*s was against them, to destroy them from among the host, until they were consumed.
So*p it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
That*p the Lord*s spake unto me, saying,
Thou*p art to pass over through Ar, the coast of Moab, this day:

And*p when thou comest nigh over against the children of Ammon, distress them not, nor meddle with them: for I will not give thee of the land of the children of Ammon any possession; because I have given it unto the children of Lot for a possession.
(That*p also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old time; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims;
A*p people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims; but the Lord*s destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead:
As*p he did to the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, when he destroyed the Horims from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day:
And*p the Avims which dwelt in Hazerim, even unto Gaza, the Caphtorims, which came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.)

Rise*p ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon: behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.

This*p day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.
And*p I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
Let*p me pass through thy land: I will go along by the high way, I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
Thou*p shalt sell me meat for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only I will pass through on my feet;
(As*p the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites which dwell in Ar, did unto me;) until I shall pass over Jordan into the land which the Lord*s our God giveth us.
But*p Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the Lord*s thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as appeareth this day.
And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his land.
Then*p Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.
And*p the Lord*s our God delivered him before us; and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people.
And*p we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every city, we left none to remain:
Only*p the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took.

From*p Aroer, which is by the brink of the river of Arnon, and from the city that is by the river, even unto Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us: the Lord*s our God delivered all unto us:
Only*p unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not, nor unto any place of the river Jabbok, nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever the Lord*s our God forbad us.
Deuteronomy 3
Then*p we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.

And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Fear him not: for I will deliver him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
So*p the Lord*s our God delivered into our hands Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
And*p we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
All*p these cities were fenced with high walls, gates, and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many.
And*p we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.
But*p all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.
And*p we took at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites the land that was on this side Jordan, from the river of Arnon unto mount Hermon;
(Which*p Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion; and the Amorites call it Senir;)
All*p the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

For*p only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.
And*p this land, which we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which is by the river Arnon, and half mount Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
And*p the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, being the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.
Jair*p the son of Manasseh took all the country of Argob unto the coasts of Geshuri and Maachathi; and called them after his own name, Bashan–havoth–jair, unto this day.
And*p I gave Gilead unto Machir.
And*p unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the river Arnon half the valley, and the border even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon;
The*p plain also, and Jordan, and the coast thereof, from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, under Ashdoth–pisgah eastward.

And*p I commanded you at that time, saying, The Lord*s your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all that are meet for the war.
But*p your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle, (for I know that ye have much cattle,) shall abide in your cities which I have given you;

Until*p the Lord*s have given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and until they also possess the land which the Lord*s your God hath given them beyond Jordan: and then shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.
And*p I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the Lord*s your God hath done unto these two kings: so shall the Lord*s do unto all the kingdoms whither thou passest.
Ye*p shall not fear them: for the Lord*s your God he shall fight for you.
And*p I besought the Lord*s at that time, saying,
O*p Lord God,*s thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might?
I*p pray thee, let me go over, and see the good land that is beyond Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.
But*p the Lord*s was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the Lord*s said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.
Get*p thee up into the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold it with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
But*p charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.
So*p we abode in the valley over against Beth–peor.
Deuteronomy 4

Now*p therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the statutes and unto the judgments, which I teach you, for to do them, that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which the Lord*s God of your fathers giveth you.
Ye*p shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish ought from it, that ye may keep the commandments of the Lord*s your God which I command you.
Your*p eyes have seen what the Lord*s did because of Baal–peor: for all the men that followed Baal–peor, the Lord*s thy God hath destroyed them from among you.
But*p ye that did cleave unto the Lord*s your God are alive every one of you this day.
Behold,*p I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the Lord*s my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it.

Keep*p therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
For*p what nation is there so great, who hath God so nigh unto them, as the Lord*s our God is in all things that we call upon him for?
And*p what nation is there so great, that hath statutes and judgments so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?

Only*p take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life: but teach them thy sons, and thy sons' sons;

Specially*p the day that thou stoodest before the Lord*s thy God in Horeb, when the Lord*s said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children.
And*p ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only ye heard a voice.
And*p he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
And*p the Lord*s commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it.
Take*p ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of similitude on the day that the Lord*s spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire:
Lest*p ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
The*p likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the air,
The*p likeness of any thing that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth:

And*p lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, even all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve them, which the Lord*s thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole heaven.
But*p the Lord*s hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, even out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of inheritance, as ye are this day.

Furthermore*p the Lord*s was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that I should not go in unto that good land, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee for an inheritance:
But*p I must die in this land, I must not go over Jordan: but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.

Take*p heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the Lord*s your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, which the Lord*s thy God hath forbidden thee.
For*p the Lord*s thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God.

When*p thou shalt beget children, and children's children, and ye shall have remained long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, and shall do evil in the sight of the Lord*s thy God, to provoke him to anger:

I*p call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
And*p the Lord*s shall scatter you among the nations, and ye shall be left few in number among the heathen, whither the Lord*s shall lead you.
And*p there ye shall serve gods, the work of men's hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
But*p if from thence thou shalt seek the Lord*s thy God, thou shalt find him, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
When*p thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to the Lord*s thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;
(For*p the Lord*s thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

For*p ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and ask from the one side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?
Did*p ever people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?

Or*p hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the Lord*s your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
Unto*p thee it was shewed, that thou mightest know that the Lord*s he is God; there is none else beside him.
Out*p of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.
And*p because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty power out of Egypt;
To*p drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as it is this day.
Know*p therefore this day, and consider it in thine heart, that the Lord*s he is God in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: there is none else.

Thou*p shalt keep therefore his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days upon the earth, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, for ever.
Then*p Moses severed three cities on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
That*p the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbour unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
Namely,*p Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, of the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, of the Manassites.
And*p this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:
These*p are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came forth out of Egypt,

On*p this side Jordan, in the valley over against Beth–peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come forth out of Egypt:
And*p they possessed his land, and the land of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, which were on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
From*p Aroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto mount Sion, which is Hermon,
And*p all the plain on this side Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
Deuteronomy 5
And*p Moses called all Israel, and said unto them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and judgments which I speak in your ears this day, that ye may learn them, and keep, and do them.
The*p Lord*s our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
The*p Lord*s made not this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day.
The*p Lord*s talked with you face to face in the mount out of the midst of the fire,
(I*p stood between the Lord*s and you at that time, to shew you the word of the Lord:*s for ye were afraid by reason of the fire, and went not up into the mount;) saying,
I*p am the Lord*s thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
Thou*p shalt have none other gods before me.
Thou*p shalt not make thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the waters beneath the earth:

Thou*p shalt not bow down thyself unto them, nor serve them: for I the Lord*s thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me,
And*p shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.
Thou*p shalt not take the name of the Lord*s thy God in vain: for the Lord*s will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
Keep*p the sabbath day to sanctify it, as the Lord*s thy God hath commanded thee.
Six*p days thou shalt labour, and do all thy work:

But*p the seventh day is the sabbath of the Lord*s thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, nor thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass, nor any of thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates; that thy manservant and thy maidservant may rest as well as thou.

And*p remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and that the Lord*s thy God brought thee out thence through a mighty hand and by a stretched out arm: therefore the Lord*s thy God commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.
Honour*p thy father and thy mother, as the Lord*s thy God hath commanded thee; that thy days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with thee, in the land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee.
Thou*p shalt not kill.
Neither*p shalt thou commit adultery.
Neither*p shalt thou steal.
Neither*p shalt thou bear false witness against thy neighbour.

Neither*p shalt thou desire thy neighbour's wife, neither shalt thou covet thy neighbour's house, his field, or his manservant, or his maidservant, his ox, or his ass, or any thing that is thy neighbour's.

These*p words the Lord*s spake unto all your assembly in the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. And he wrote them in two tables of stone, and delivered them unto me.
And*p it came to pass, when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, (for the mountain did burn with fire,) that ye came near unto me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;

And*p ye said, Behold, the Lord*s our God hath shewed us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God doth talk with man, and he liveth.
Now*p therefore why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of the Lord*s our God any more, then we shall die.
For*p who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
Go*p thou near, and hear all that the Lord*s our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that the Lord*s our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.

And*p the Lord*s heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me; and the Lord*s said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have spoken.
O*p that there were such an heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them, and with their children for ever!
Go*p say to them, Get you into your tents again.

But*p as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto thee all the commandments, and the statutes, and the judgments, which thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.
Ye*p shall observe to do therefore as the Lord*s your God hath commanded you: ye shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
Ye*p shall walk in all the ways which the Lord*s your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.
Deuteronomy 6
Now*p these are the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments, which the Lord*s your God commanded to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go to possess it:

That*p thou mightest fear the Lord*s thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou, and thy son, and thy son's son, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged.

Hear*p therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily, as the Lord*s God of thy fathers hath promised thee, in the land that floweth with milk and honey.
Hear,*p O Israel: The Lord*s our God is one Lord:*s
And*p thou shalt love the Lord*s thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
And*p these words, which I command thee this day, shall be in thine heart:
And*p thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
And*p thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand, and they shall be as frontlets between thine eyes.
And*p thou shalt write them upon the posts of thy house, and on thy gates.

And*p it shall be, when the Lord*s thy God shall have brought thee into the land which he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give thee great and goodly cities, which thou buildedst not,
And*p houses full of all good things, which thou filledst not, and wells digged, which thou diggedst not, vineyards and olive trees, which thou plantedst not; when thou shalt have eaten and be full;
Then*p beware lest thou forget the Lord,*s which brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
Thou*p shalt fear the Lord*s thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.
Ye*p shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the people which are round about you;
(For*p the Lord*s thy God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the Lord*s thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
Ye*p shall not tempt the Lord*s your God, as ye tempted him in Massah.
Ye*p shall diligently keep the commandments of the Lord*s your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he hath commanded thee.

And*p thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of the Lord:*s that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in and possess the good land which the Lord*s sware unto thy fathers,
To*p cast out all thine enemies from before thee, as the Lord*s hath spoken.
And*p when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which the Lord*s our God hath commanded you?
Then*p thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh's bondmen in Egypt; and the Lord*s brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand:
And*p the Lord*s shewed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his household, before our eyes:
And*p he brought us out from thence, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.
And*p the Lord*s commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the Lord*s our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as it is at this day.
And*p it shall be our righteousness, if we observe to do all these commandments before the Lord*s our God, as he hath commanded us.
Deuteronomy 7

When*p the Lord*s thy God shall bring thee into the land whither thou goest to possess it, and hath cast out many nations before thee, the Hittites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than thou;
And*p when the Lord*s thy God shall deliver them before thee; thou shalt smite them, and utterly destroy them; thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor shew mercy unto them:
Neither*p shalt thou make marriages with them; thy daughter thou shalt not give unto his son, nor his daughter shalt thou take unto thy son.
For*p they will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of the Lord*s be kindled against you, and destroy thee suddenly.
But*p thus shall ye deal with them; ye shall destroy their altars, and break down their images, and cut down their groves, and burn their graven images with fire.
For*p thou art an holy people unto the Lord*s thy God: the Lord*s thy God hath chosen thee to be a special people unto himself, above all people that are upon the face of the earth.
The*p Lord*s did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people; for ye were the fewest of all people:

But*p because the Lord*s loved you, and because he would keep the oath which he had sworn unto your fathers, hath the Lord*s brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the house of bondmen, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
Know*p therefore that the Lord*s thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;
And*p repayeth them that hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him that hateth him, he will repay him to his face.
Thou*p shalt therefore keep the commandments, and the statutes, and the judgments, which I command thee this day, to do them.
Wherefore*p it shall come to pass, if ye hearken to these judgments, and keep, and do them, that the Lord*s thy God shall keep unto thee the covenant and the mercy which he sware unto thy fathers:

And*p he will love thee, and bless thee, and multiply thee: he will also bless the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy land, thy corn, and thy wine, and thine oil, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep, in the land which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee.
Thou*p shalt be blessed above all people: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your cattle.
And*p the Lord*s will take away from thee all sickness, and will put none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which thou knowest, upon thee; but will lay them upon all them that hate thee.
And*p thou shalt consume all the people which the Lord*s thy God shall deliver thee; thine eye shall have no pity upon them: neither shalt thou serve their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee.
If*p thou shalt say in thine heart, These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?
Thou*p shalt not be afraid of them: but shalt well remember what the Lord*s thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt;

The*p great temptations which thine eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the stretched out arm, whereby the Lord*s thy God brought thee out: so shall the Lord*s thy God do unto all the people of whom thou art afraid.
Moreover*p the Lord*s thy God will send the hornet among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves from thee, be destroyed.
Thou*p shalt not be affrighted at them: for the Lord*s thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.
And*p the Lord*s thy God will put out those nations before thee by little and little: thou mayest not consume them at once, lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.
But*p the Lord*s thy God shall deliver them unto thee, and shall destroy them with a mighty destruction, until they be destroyed.
And*p he shall deliver their kings into thine hand, and thou shalt destroy their name from under heaven: there shall no man be able to stand before thee, until thou have destroyed them.

The*p graven images of their gods shall ye burn with fire: thou shalt not desire the silver or gold that is on them, nor take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therein: for it is an abomination to the Lord*s thy God.
Neither*p shalt thou bring an abomination into thine house, lest thou be a cursed thing like it: but thou shalt utterly detest it, and thou shalt utterly abhor it; for it is a cursed thing.
Deuteronomy 8
All*p the commandments which I command thee this day shall ye observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which the Lord*s sware unto your fathers.

And*p thou shalt remember all the way which the Lord*s thy God led thee these forty years in the wilderness, to humble thee, and to prove thee, to know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his commandments, or no.

And*p he humbled thee, and suffered thee to hunger, and fed thee with manna, which thou knewest not, neither did thy fathers know; that he might make thee know that man doth not live by bread only, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the Lord*s doth man live.
Thy*p raiment waxed not old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell, these forty years.
Thou*p shalt also consider in thine heart, that, as a man chasteneth his son, so the Lord*s thy God chasteneth thee.
Therefore*p thou shalt keep the commandments of the Lord*s thy God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
For*p the Lord*s thy God bringeth thee into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and depths that spring out of valleys and hills;
A*p land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of oil olive, and honey;
A*p land wherein thou shalt eat bread without scarceness, thou shalt not lack any thing in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills thou mayest dig brass.
When*p thou hast eaten and art full, then thou shalt bless the Lord*s thy God for the good land which he hath given thee.
Beware*p that thou forget not the Lord*s thy God, in not keeping his commandments, and his judgments, and his statutes, which I command thee this day:
Lest*p when thou hast eaten and art full, and hast built goodly houses, and dwelt therein;
And*p when thy herds and thy flocks multiply, and thy silver and thy gold is multiplied, and all that thou hast is multiplied;
Then*p thine heart be lifted up, and thou forget the Lord*s thy God, which brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage;
Who*p led thee through that great and terrible wilderness, wherein were fiery serpents, and scorpions, and drought, where there was no water; who brought thee forth water out of the rock of flint;
Who*p fed thee in the wilderness with manna, which thy fathers knew not, that he might humble thee, and that he might prove thee, to do thee good at thy latter end;
And*p thou say in thine heart, My power and the might of mine hand hath gotten me this wealth.
But*p thou shalt remember the Lord*s thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.
And*p it shall be, if thou do at all forget the Lord*s thy God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify against you this day that ye shall surely perish.
As*p the nations which the Lord*s destroyeth before your face, so shall ye perish; because ye would not be obedient unto the voice of the Lord*s your God.
Deuteronomy 9
Hear,*p O Israel: Thou art to pass over Jordan this day, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to heaven,
A*p people great and tall, the children of the Anakims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, Who can stand before the children of Anak!

Understand*p therefore this day, that the Lord*s thy God is he which goeth over before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the Lord*s hath said unto thee.

Speak*p not thou in thine heart, after that the Lord*s thy God hath cast them out from before thee, saying, For my righteousness the Lord*s hath brought me in to possess this land: but for the wickedness of these nations the Lord*s doth drive them out from before thee.

Not*p for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wickedness of these nations the Lord*s thy God doth drive them out from before thee, and that he may perform the word which the Lord*s sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Understand*p therefore, that the Lord*s thy God giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy righteousness; for thou art a stiffnecked people.

Remember,*p and forget not, how thou provokedst the Lord*s thy God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the Lord.*s
Also*p in Horeb ye provoked the Lord*s to wrath, so that the Lord*s was angry with you to have destroyed you.

When*p I was gone up into the mount to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which the Lord*s made with you, then I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, I neither did eat bread nor drink water:

And*p the Lord*s delivered unto me two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them was written according to all the words, which the Lord*s spake with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
And*p it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that the Lord*s gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant.

And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Arise, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy people which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they are quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image.
Furthermore*p the Lord*s spake unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people:
Let*p me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven: and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
So*p I turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands.
And*p I looked, and, behold, ye had sinned against the Lord*s your God, and had made you a molten calf: ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which the Lord*s had commanded you.
And*p I took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before your eyes.

And*p I fell down before the Lord,*s as at the first, forty days and forty nights: I did neither eat bread, nor drink water, because of all your sins which ye sinned, in doing wickedly in the sight of the Lord,*s to provoke him to anger.
For*p I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, wherewith the Lord*s was wroth against you to destroy you. But the Lord*s hearkened unto me at that time also.
And*p the Lord*s was very angry with Aaron to have destroyed him: and I prayed for Aaron also the same time.

And*p I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, and ground it very small, even until it was as small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
And*p at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth–hattaavah, ye provoked the Lord*s to wrath.

Likewise*p when the Lord*s sent you from Kadesh–barnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you; then ye rebelled against the commandment of the Lord*s your God, and ye believed him not, nor hearkened to his voice.
Ye*p have been rebellious against the Lord*s from the day that I knew you.
Thus*p I fell down before the Lord*s forty days and forty nights, as I fell down at the first; because the Lord*s had said he would destroy you.

I*p prayed therefore unto the Lord,*s and said, O Lord God,*s destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
Remember*p thy servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin:

Lest*p the land whence thou broughtest us out say, Because the Lord*s was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, and because he hated them, he hath brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.
Yet*p they are thy people and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty power and by thy stretched out arm.
Deuteronomy 10
At*p that time the Lord*s said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an ark of wood.
And*p I will write on the tables the words that were in the first tables which thou brakest, and thou shalt put them in the ark.
And*p I made an ark of shittim wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in mine hand.

And*p he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which the Lord*s spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and the Lord*s gave them unto me.
And*p I turned myself and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they be, as the Lord*s commanded me.

And*p the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan to Moserah: there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest's office in his stead.
From*p thence they journeyed unto Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of rivers of waters.
At*p that time the Lord*s separated the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of the Lord,*s to stand before the Lord*s to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, unto this day.
Wherefore*p Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; the Lord*s is his inheritance, according as the Lord*s thy God promised him.
And*p I stayed in the mount, according to the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the Lord*s hearkened unto me at that time also, and the Lord*s would not destroy thee.
And*p the Lord*s said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.

And*p now, Israel, what doth the Lord*s thy God require of thee, but to fear the Lord*s thy God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve the Lord*s thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
To*p keep the commandments of the Lord,*s and his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
Behold,*p the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the Lord's*s thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.
Only*p the Lord*s had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.
Circumcise*p therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.
For*p the Lord*s your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:
He*p doth execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment.
Love*p ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Thou*p shalt fear the Lord*s thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
He*p is thy praise, and he is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.
Thy*p fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; and now the Lord*s thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
Deuteronomy 11
Therefore*p thou shalt love the Lord*s thy God, and keep his charge, and his statutes, and his judgments, and his commandments, alway.

And*p know ye this day: for I speak not with your children which have not known, and which have not seen the chastisement of the Lord*s your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his stretched out arm,
And*p his miracles, and his acts, which he did in the midst of Egypt unto Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and unto all his land;

And*p what he did unto the army of Egypt, unto their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Red sea to overflow them as they pursued after you, and how the Lord*s hath destroyed them unto this day;
And*p what he did unto you in the wilderness, until ye came into this place;

And*p what he did unto Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben: how the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and their tents, and all the substance that was in their possession, in the midst of all Israel:
But*p your eyes have seen all the great acts of the Lord*s which he did.
Therefore*p shall ye keep all the commandments which I command you this day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land, whither ye go to possess it;
And*p that ye may prolong your days in the land, which the Lord*s sware unto your fathers to give unto them and to their seed, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
For*p the land, whither thou goest in to possess it, is not as the land of Egypt, from whence ye came out, where thou sowedst thy seed, and wateredst it with thy foot, as a garden of herbs:
But*p the land, whither ye go to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys, and drinketh water of the rain of heaven:
A*p land which the Lord*s thy God careth for: the eyes of the Lord*s thy God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year even unto the end of the year.

And*p it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken diligently unto my commandments which I command you this day, to love the Lord*s your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
That*p I will give you the rain of your land in his due season, the first rain and the latter rain, that thou mayest gather in thy corn, and thy wine, and thine oil.
And*p I will send grass in thy fields for thy cattle, that thou mayest eat and be full.
Take*p heed to yourselves, that your heart be not deceived, and ye turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them;

And*p then the Lord's*s wrath be kindled against you, and he shut up the heaven, that there be no rain, and that the land yield not her fruit; and lest ye perish quickly from off the good land which the Lord*s giveth you.
Therefore*p shall ye lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be as frontlets between your eyes.
And*p ye shall teach them your children, speaking of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
And*p thou shalt write them upon the door posts of thine house, and upon thy gates:
That*p your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which the Lord*s sware unto your fathers to give them, as the days of heaven upon the earth.
For*p if ye shall diligently keep all these commandments which I command you, to do them, to love the Lord*s your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cleave unto him;
Then*p will the Lord*s drive out all these nations from before you, and ye shall possess greater nations and mightier than yourselves.
Every*p place whereon the soles of your feet shall tread shall be yours: from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even unto the uttermost sea shall your coast be.
There*p shall no man be able to stand before you: for the Lord*s your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he hath said unto you.
Behold,*p I set before you this day a blessing and a curse;
A*p blessing, if ye obey the commandments of the Lord*s your God, which I command you this day:
And*p a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the Lord*s your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.

And*p it shall come to pass, when the Lord*s thy God hath brought thee in unto the land whither thou goest to possess it, that thou shalt put the blessing upon mount Gerizim, and the curse upon mount Ebal.
Are*p they not on the other side Jordan, by the way where the sun goeth down, in the land of the Canaanites, which dwell in the champaign over against Gilgal, beside the plains of Moreh?
For*p ye shall pass over Jordan to go in to possess the land which the Lord*s your God giveth you, and ye shall possess it, and dwell therein.
And*p ye shall observe to do all the statutes and judgments which I set before you this day.
Deuteronomy 12
These*p are the statutes and judgments, which ye shall observe to do in the land, which the Lord*s God of thy fathers giveth thee to possess it, all the days that ye live upon the earth.
Ye*p shall utterly destroy all the places, wherein the nations which ye shall possess served their gods, upon the high mountains, and upon the hills, and under every green tree:

And*p ye shall overthrow their altars, and break their pillars, and burn their groves with fire; and ye shall hew down the graven images of their gods, and destroy the names of them out of that place.
Ye*p shall not do so unto the Lord*s your God.
But*p unto the place which the Lord*s your God shall choose out of all your tribes to put his name there, even unto his habitation shall ye seek, and thither thou shalt come:

And*p thither ye shall bring your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and heave offerings of your hand, and your vows, and your freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and of your flocks:
And*p there ye shall eat before the Lord*s your God, and ye shall rejoice in all that ye put your hand unto, ye and your households, wherein the Lord*s thy God hath blessed thee.
Ye*p shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.
For*p ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which the Lord*s your God giveth you.
But*p when ye go over Jordan, and dwell in the land which the Lord*s your God giveth you to inherit, and when he giveth you rest from all your enemies round about, so that ye dwell in safety;

Then*p there shall be a place which the Lord*s your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there; thither shall ye bring all that I command you; your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, and the heave offering of your hand, and all your choice vows which ye vow unto the Lord:*s

And*p ye shall rejoice before the Lord*s your God, ye, and your sons, and your daughters, and your menservants, and your maidservants, and the Levite that is within your gates; forasmuch as he hath no part nor inheritance with you.
Take*p heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou seest:
But*p in the place which the Lord*s shall choose in one of thy tribes, there thou shalt offer thy burnt offerings, and there thou shalt do all that I command thee.

Notwithstanding*p thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thy gates, whatsoever thy soul lusteth after, according to the blessing of the Lord*s thy God which he hath given thee: the unclean and the clean may eat thereof, as of the roebuck, and as of the hart.
Only*p ye shall not eat the blood; ye shall pour it upon the earth as water.

Thou*p mayest not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy corn, or of thy wine, or of thy oil, or the firstlings of thy herds or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy freewill offerings, or heave offering of thine hand:

But*p thou must eat them before the Lord*s thy God in the place which the Lord*s thy God shall choose, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite that is within thy gates: and thou shalt rejoice before the Lord*s thy God in all that thou puttest thine hands unto.
Take*p heed to thyself that thou forsake not the Levite as long as thou livest upon the earth.

When*p the Lord*s thy God shall enlarge thy border, as he hath promised thee, and thou shalt say, I will eat flesh, because thy soul longeth to eat flesh; thou mayest eat flesh, whatsoever thy soul lusteth after.

If*p the place which the Lord*s thy God hath chosen to put his name there be too far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thy herd and of thy flock, which the Lord*s hath given thee, as I have commanded thee, and thou shalt eat in thy gates whatsoever thy soul lusteth after.
Even*p as the roebuck and the hart is eaten, so thou shalt eat them: the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.
Only*p be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the life; and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh.
Thou*p shalt not eat it; thou shalt pour it upon the earth as water.
Thou*p shalt not eat it; that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the Lord.*s
Only*p thy holy things which thou hast, and thy vows, thou shalt take, and go unto the place which the Lord*s shall choose:

And*p thou shalt offer thy burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon the altar of the Lord*s thy God: and the blood of thy sacrifices shall be poured out upon the altar of the Lord*s thy God, and thou shalt eat the flesh.

Observe*p and hear all these words which I command thee, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee for ever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the Lord*s thy God.
When*p the Lord*s thy God shall cut off the nations from before thee, whither thou goest to possess them, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their land;

Take*p heed to thyself that thou be not snared by following them, after that they be destroyed from before thee; and that thou enquire not after their gods, saying, How did these nations serve their gods? even so will I do likewise.

Thou*p shalt not do so unto the Lord*s thy God: for every abomination to the Lord,*s which he hateth, have they done unto their gods; for even their sons and their daughters they have burnt in the fire to their gods.
What*p thing soever I command you, observe to do it: thou shalt not add thereto, nor diminish from it.
Deuteronomy 13
If*p there arise among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and giveth thee a sign or a wonder,
And*p the sign or the wonder come to pass, whereof he spake unto thee, saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serve them;

Thou*p shalt not hearken unto the words of that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams: for the Lord*s your God proveth you, to know whether ye love the Lord*s your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
Ye*p shall walk after the Lord*s your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and ye shall serve him, and cleave unto him.

And*p that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death; because he hath spoken to turn you away from the Lord*s your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which the Lord*s thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shalt thou put the evil away from the midst of thee.

If*p thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son, or thy daughter, or the wife of thy bosom, or thy friend, which is as thine own soul, entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou, nor thy fathers;
Namely,*p of the gods of the people which are round about you, nigh unto thee, or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth;
Thou*p shalt not consent unto him, nor hearken unto him; neither shall thine eye pity him, neither shalt thou spare, neither shalt thou conceal him:
But*p thou shalt surely kill him; thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.
And*p thou shalt stone him with stones, that he die; because he hath sought to thrust thee away from the Lord*s thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
And*p all Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall do no more any such wickedness as this is among you.
If*p thou shalt hear say in one of thy cities, which the Lord*s thy God hath given thee to dwell there, saying,
Certain*p men, the children of Belial, are gone out from among you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known;
Then*p shalt thou enquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought among you;
Thou*p shalt surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein, and the cattle thereof, with the edge of the sword.

And*p thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street thereof, and shalt burn with fire the city, and all the spoil thereof every whit, for the Lord*s thy God: and it shall be an heap for ever; it shall not be built again.

And*p there shall cleave nought of the cursed thing to thine hand: that the Lord*s may turn from the fierceness of his anger, and shew thee mercy, and have compassion upon thee, and multiply thee, as he hath sworn unto thy fathers;
When*p thou shalt hearken to the voice of the Lord*s thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the Lord*s thy God.
Deuteronomy 14
Ye*p are the children of the Lord*s your God: ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
For*p thou art an holy people unto the Lord*s thy God, and the Lord*s hath chosen thee to be a peculiar people unto himself, above all the nations that are upon the earth.
Thou*p shalt not eat any abominable thing.
These*p are the beasts which ye shall eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
The*p hart, and the roebuck, and the fallow deer, and the wild goat, and the pygarg, and the wild ox, and the chamois.
And*p every beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that ye shall eat.

Nevertheless*p these ye shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the cloven hoof; as the camel, and the hare, and the coney: for they chew the cud, but divide not the hoof; therefore they are unclean unto you.
And*p the swine, because it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, it is unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcase.
These*p ye shall eat of all that are in the waters: all that have fins and scales shall ye eat:
And*p whatsoever hath not fins and scales ye may not eat; it is unclean unto you.
Of*p all clean birds ye shall eat.
But*p these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
And*p the glede, and the kite, and the vulture after his kind,
And*p every raven after his kind,
And*p the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
The*p little owl, and the great owl, and the swan,
And*p the pelican, and the gier eagle, and the cormorant,
And*p the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
And*p every creeping thing that flieth is unclean unto you: they shall not be eaten.
But*p of all clean fowls ye may eat.

Ye*p shall not eat of any thing that dieth of itself: thou shalt give it unto the stranger that is in thy gates, that he may eat it; or thou mayest sell it unto an alien: for thou art an holy people unto the Lord*s thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
Thou*p shalt truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year.

And*p thou shalt eat before the Lord*s thy God, in the place which he shall choose to place his name there, the tithe of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the firstlings of thy herds and of thy flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the Lord*s thy God always.

And*p if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place be too far from thee, which the Lord*s thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the Lord*s thy God hath blessed thee:
Then*p shalt thou turn it into money, and bind up the money in thine hand, and shalt go unto the place which the Lord*s thy God shall choose:

And*p thou shalt bestow that money for whatsoever thy soul lusteth after, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatsoever thy soul desireth: and thou shalt eat there before the Lord*s thy God, and thou shalt rejoice, thou, and thine household,
And*p the Levite that is within thy gates; thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.
At*p the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thine increase the same year, and shalt lay it up within thy gates:

And*p the Levite, (because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee,) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which are within thy gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that the Lord*s thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou doest.
Deuteronomy 15
At*p the end of every seven years thou shalt make a release.

And*p this is the manner of the release: Every creditor that lendeth ought unto his neighbour shall release it; he shall not exact it of his neighbour, or of his brother; because it is called the Lord's*s release.
Of*p a foreigner thou mayest exact it again: but that which is thine with thy brother thine hand shall release;
Save*p when there shall be no poor among you; for the Lord*s shall greatly bless thee in the land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it:
Only*p if thou carefully hearken unto the voice of the Lord*s thy God, to observe to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.

For*p the Lord*s thy God blesseth thee, as he promised thee: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over thee.

If*p there be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother:
But*p thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.

Beware*p that there be not a thought in thy wicked heart, saying, The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand; and thine eye be evil against thy poor brother, and thou givest him nought; and he cry unto the Lord*s against thee, and it be sin unto thee.

Thou*p shalt surely give him, and thine heart shall not be grieved when thou givest unto him: because that for this thing the Lord*s thy God shall bless thee in all thy works, and in all that thou puttest thine hand unto.
For*p the poor shall never cease out of the land: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy, in thy land.
And*p if thy brother, an Hebrew man, or an Hebrew woman, be sold unto thee, and serve thee six years; then in the seventh year thou shalt let him go free from thee.
And*p when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him go away empty:
Thou*p shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock, and out of thy floor, and out of thy winepress: of that wherewith the Lord*s thy God hath blessed thee thou shalt give unto him.
And*p thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt, and the Lord*s thy God redeemed thee: therefore I command thee this thing to day.
And*p it shall be, if he say unto thee, I will not go away from thee; because he loveth thee and thine house, because he is well with thee;
Then*p thou shalt take an awl, and thrust it through his ear unto the door, and he shall be thy servant for ever. And also unto thy maidservant thou shalt do likewise.

It*p shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been worth a double hired servant to thee, in serving thee six years: and the Lord*s thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest.

All*p the firstling males that come of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify unto the Lord*s thy God: thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thy bullock, nor shear the firstling of thy sheep.
Thou*p shalt eat it before the Lord*s thy God year by year in the place which the Lord*s shall choose, thou and thy household.
And*p if there be any blemish therein, as if it be lame, or blind, or have any ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto the Lord*s thy God.
Thou*p shalt eat it within thy gates: the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart.
Only*p thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it upon the ground as water.
Deuteronomy 16
Observe*p the month of Abib, and keep the passover unto the Lord*s thy God: for in the month of Abib the Lord*s thy God brought thee forth out of Egypt by night.
Thou*p shalt therefore sacrifice the passover unto the Lord*s thy God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the Lord*s shall choose to place his name there.

Thou*p shalt eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread therewith, even the bread of affliction; for thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that thou mayest remember the day when thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of thy life.

And*p there shall be no leavened bread seen with thee in all thy coast seven days; neither shall there any thing of the flesh, which thou sacrificedst the first day at even, remain all night until the morning.
Thou*p mayest not sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee:

But*p at the place which the Lord*s thy God shall choose to place his name in, there thou shalt sacrifice the passover at even, at the going down of the sun, at the season that thou camest forth out of Egypt.
And*p thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the Lord*s thy God shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morning, and go unto thy tents.
Six*p days thou shalt eat unleavened bread: and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the Lord*s thy God: thou shalt do no work therein.
Seven*p weeks shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the seven weeks from such time as thou beginnest to put the sickle to the corn.

And*p thou shalt keep the feast of weeks unto the Lord*s thy God with a tribute of a freewill offering of thine hand, which thou shalt give unto the Lord*s thy God, according as the Lord*s thy God hath blessed thee:

And*p thou shalt rejoice before the Lord*s thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite that is within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the Lord*s thy God hath chosen to place his name there.
And*p thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt: and thou shalt observe and do these statutes.
Thou*p shalt observe the feast of tabernacles seven days, after that thou hast gathered in thy corn and thy wine:

And*p thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite, the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are within thy gates.

Seven*p days shalt thou keep a solemn feast unto the Lord*s thy God in the place which the Lord*s shall choose: because the Lord*s thy God shall bless thee in all thine increase, and in all the works of thine hands, therefore thou shalt surely rejoice.

Three*p times in a year shall all thy males appear before the Lord*s thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the Lord*s empty:
Every*p man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the Lord*s thy God which he hath given thee.
Judges*p and officers shalt thou make thee in all thy gates, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, throughout thy tribes: and they shall judge the people with just judgment.
Thou*p shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect persons, neither take a gift: for a gift doth blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous.
That*p which is altogether just shalt thou follow, that thou mayest live, and inherit the land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee.
Thou*p shalt not plant thee a grove of any trees near unto the altar of the Lord*s thy God, which thou shalt make thee.
Neither*p shalt thou set thee up any image; which the Lord*s thy God hateth.
Deuteronomy 17
Thou*p shalt not sacrifice unto the Lord*s thy God any bullock, or sheep, wherein is blemish, or any evilfavouredness: for that is an abomination unto the Lord*s thy God.

If*p there be found among you, within any of thy gates which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, man or woman, that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of the Lord*s thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
And*p hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;
And*p it be told thee, and thou hast heard of it, and enquired diligently, and, behold, it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel:
Then*p shalt thou bring forth that man or that woman, which have committed that wicked thing, unto thy gates, even that man or that woman, and shalt stone them with stones, till they die.
At*p the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
The*p hands of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So thou shalt put the evil away from among you.

If*p there arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within thy gates: then shalt thou arise, and get thee up into the place which the Lord*s thy God shall choose;
And*p thou shalt come unto the priests the Levites, and unto the judge that shall be in those days, and enquire; and they shall shew thee the sentence of judgment:
And*p thou shalt do according to the sentence, which they of that place which the Lord*s shall choose shall shew thee; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee:

According*p to the sentence of the law which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shalt do: thou shalt not decline from the sentence which they shall shew thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.

And*p the man that will do presumptuously, and will not hearken unto the priest that standeth to minister there before the Lord*s thy God, or unto the judge, even that man shall die: and thou shalt put away the evil from Israel.
And*p all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.

When*p thou art come unto the land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell therein, and shalt say, I will set a king over me, like as all the nations that are about me;

Thou*p shalt in any wise set him king over thee, whom the Lord*s thy God shall choose: one from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which is not thy brother.

But*p he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he should multiply horses: forasmuch as the Lord*s hath said unto you, Ye shall henceforth return no more that way.
Neither*p shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart turn not away: neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
And*p it shall be, when he sitteth upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book out of that which is before the priests the Levites:
And*p it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life: that he may learn to fear the Lord*s his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them:

That*p his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he, and his children, in the midst of Israel.
Deuteronomy 18
The*p priests the Levites, and all the tribe of Levi, shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire, and his inheritance.
Therefore*p shall they have no inheritance among their brethren: the Lord*s is their inheritance, as he hath said unto them.
And*p this shall be the priest's due from the people, from them that offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep; and they shall give unto the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.
The*p firstfruit also of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy sheep, shalt thou give him.
For*p the Lord*s thy God hath chosen him out of all thy tribes, to stand to minister in the name of the Lord,*s him and his sons for ever.
And*p if a Levite come from any of thy gates out of all Israel, where he sojourned, and come with all the desire of his mind unto the place which the Lord*s shall choose;
Then*p he shall minister in the name of the Lord*s his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, which stand there before the Lord.*s
They*p shall have like portions to eat, beside that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.
When*p thou art come into the land which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.
There*p shall not be found among you any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or an observer of times, or an enchanter, or a witch,
Or*p a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
For*p all that do these things are an abomination unto the Lord:*s and because of these abominations the Lord*s thy God doth drive them out from before thee.
Thou*p shalt be perfect with the Lord*s thy God.
For*p these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearkened unto observers of times, and unto diviners: but as for thee, the Lord*s thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.
The*p Lord*s thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;

According*p to all that thou desiredst of the Lord*s thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the Lord*s my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.
And*p the Lord*s said unto me, They have well spoken that which they have spoken.
